lexUnit.name: huddle.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: curl one's body into a small space.

sentence.text: They left , and while the adults were talking and stuffing themselves , I picked up a piece of pig 's pudding for Frankie who was still huddled by the fire .
Now we were huddled against the wall of sheer , pale grey rock that soared seamlessly into the sky , up into the ice-white clouds above .
The slaves were huddled together in a corner , their faces turned away , as if afraid that the Soul Eater 's attention might suddenly turn to one of them .
I was huddled under a bush and it started to snow -- I could have got frostbite but that did n't bother the gaffer .
The inhabitants huddle around huge log fires in timber halls protected by massive stockades .
She lay stiffly as he huddled close , sharing the warmth .
A picture came to her of the shaggy wanderers huddling together in the bus shelter at the top of the road where she had been born and bred .
Her body had stiffened for a moment but she made herself relax and huddle against him .
We huddle beneath the covers , but to our dismay , the one duvet is but a slim pink layer of fabric resembling a furniture cover .
She was still trembling half an hour later , as she huddled beneath a small gateway , trying to keep her footing on the wet grass of the embankment .
Huddling by the fire he waited impatiently for daylight and his relief .
I tried to start the engine but the airman on the starter battery trailer had fled so I could not do a thing except huddle in the cockpit , waiting for the sensation of being hit .
The animals huddled in a corner , shaking with fear .
Dozens of Pakistanis , Indians and Turks huddle in groups on the pavement , stamping their feet against the cold .
Madeleine and Victorine stood behind his wheelchair , like nurses , while the two girls huddled on the windowseat .
People sleep on the floor or huddle round television sets .
Five students and an adventure group leader stranded in force 10 winds , torrential rain and sub-zero temperatures were found huddling under a plastic bag and singing songs at Dartmoor , Devon .
Three men huddle uncomfortably at one end of the table .
Squeezed like despondent sardines , they looked as if they were huddling for warmth .
Amanda was worried , she huddled up close to him , her blonde hair against his neck , and he felt protective and capable of dealing with men in raincoats .
In the evenings , after a dinner collected by the ladies from along the road , we huddled round the fire , playing bridge .

Another kind developed in which the elaborated worm did not attach itself to the sea floor but continued to crawl about and secreted a small conical tent of shell under which it could huddle when in danger .
